description: This requirement is for: The Correctional Service of Canada, Warkworth Institution, Warkworth Ontario. \\r\\n\\r\\nTrade agreement: This procurement is not subject to any trade agreement.\\r\\n\\r\\nTendering procedures: All interested suppliers may submit a bid.\\r\\n\\r\\nCompetitive Procurement Strategy: Lowest priced compliant bid.\\r\\n\\r\\nSet-aside under the not subject to a Comprehensive Land Claims Agreement.\\r\\n\\r\\nSecurity Requirements: This contract includes security requirements.\\r\\n\\r\\nNature of Requirements: \\r\\nThe following is a summary of the statement of work for this requirement. \\r\\n\\r\\nThe Correctional Service Canada (CSC) Health Services require services from Physiotherapists.\\r\\n\\r\\nObjectives: To meet CSC\u2019s mandate to implement primary health care and essential health services at all stages of an offender\u2019s sentence: in particular the provision of physiotherapy as outlined in the statement of work.\\r\\n\\r\\nDeliverables: To provide physiotherapy to offenders in accordance with the College of Physiotherapists of Ontario professional practice standards and related guidelines at Warkworth Institution. \\r\\n\\r\\n Any conditions for participation of suppliers not specified in solicitation documentation: none.\\r\\n\\r\\nEstimated quantity of commodity: see solicitation document statement of work and basis of payment.\\r\\n\\r\\nDuration of Contract and Time Frame for Delivery: \\r\\nPeriod of the Contract: The Work is to be performed during the period of January 1, 2025 to December 31, 2025 with the option to renew for four (4) additional one-year periods.\\r\\n\\r\\nFile Number: 21460-25-4764025\\r\\n\\r\\nContracting Authority: Mackenzie Chisholm\\r\\nTelephone number: 343-596-0675\\r\\nE-mail: Mackenzie.Chisholm@csc-scc.gc.ca\\r\\n\\r\\nNOTE TO BIDDERS: Bidders can obtain the complete statement of work and evaluation criteria by downloading the solicitation document and associated documents from the Canada buys / tender opportunities website.\\r\\n\\r\\nThe Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.\\r\\n\\r\\nDocuments may be submitted in either official language of Canada (English or French).\\r\\n\\r\\nAfter contract award, bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process. Bidders should make the request to the Contracting Authority within fifteen (15) working days of receipt of the results of the bid solicitation process. The debriefing may be in writing, by telephone or in person.\\r\\n\\r\\nProcurement Assistance Canada (PAC) offers seminars to businesses interested in learning how to sell goods and services to the Government of Canada. Discover how to prepare to sell to the government.\\\\r\\n\\r\\n The full schedule of seminars can be found on the Procurement Assistance Canada website, under find an event (Procurement Assistance Canada: Find an event - Canada.ca).
full_summary:
================================

### Physiotherapy Services - Warkworth Institution

Government of Canada's Tender Announcement (Request for Proposal)

#### Tender Details

* **Tender Reference Number:** 4764025
* **Posting Date:** 2024-11-12
* **Tender Closing Date:** 2024-12-02 14:00:00
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** 2025-01-01
* **Expected Contract End Date:** 2029-12-31
* **Status:** Open

#### Background

The Correctional Service of Canada, Warkworth Institution, requires the provision of comprehensive physiotherapy services to offenders within the institution.

#### Purpose

This procurement aims to meet the Correctional Service of Canada's (CSC) mandate to provide primary health care and essential health services to offenders at all stages of their sentence.

#### Statement of Work

The successful bidder will provide physiotherapy services to offenders in accordance with the College of Physiotherapists of Ontario professional practice standards and related guidelines.

#### Evaluation Criteria

The evaluation of bids will be based on the lowest price, as approved by the CSC.

#### Requisite

The duration of the contract will be for one year, with four (4) additional one-year renewal options, totaling a potential five (5) years.

#### Important Information

* Documents may be submitted in either English or French.
* Interested parties may obtain the complete solicitation document and evaluation criteria by downloading the documents from the Canada Buys website.
* Following contract award, a debriefing may be requested from the successful bidder within fifteen (15) working days of receipt of the results.

#### Commercial

* Trade agreements: This procurement is not subject to any trade agreement.
* Indigenous Business: This procurement is not subject to any set-asides for Indigenous suppliers. 

Attachments
-----------

* Annex E: National Essential Health Services Framework
* The Download Data Package (DDP) and associated documents from Canada Buys
* Annex G: Medical Practitioner By-Laws (English)
* Annex G: Medical Practitioner By-Laws (French)

Contact Information
------------------

*   Mackenzie Chisholm, Contracting Authority
    *   Phone: 343-596-0675
    *   Email: <mackenzie.chisholm@csc-scc.gc.ca>
    *   Postal Address: 340 Laurier Avenue West, Ottawa, ON K1A 0P9, Canada.

### How to Particip
